text:
MICHAELA: Well, award
season is in full swing.

We've had the Golden
Globes complete.

Hollywood is all about
the race to the Oscars,

and what films will be honored
at this year's Academy Awards.

So I asked our special guests
to join me for today's bubble.

"Sesame Street," you
guys are going Hollywood.
And you've got your own picks.

You guys have been paying
very close attention--

GROVER: Oh, yeah.
Absolutely.

MICHAELA: --to who should
be picking up a movie award.

COOKIE MONSTER: Oh, yes.
ELMO: That's true.

MICHAELA: Elmo, I understand
you're a big movie watcher.
What's your favorite?

ELMO: Oh, Elmo's favorite
movie is la, la, la,
la, la, la, la la, "Mamma Mia."
[laughter]

MICHAELA: You do love to
sing, don't you fella?
ELMO: Yes, yes, Elmo does.
MICHAELA: Elmo loves to sing.

And did you sing along
to the whole soundtrack?
ELMO: Absolutely.
MICHAELA: How about you, Cookie?

What's a performance
that you were watching?

COOKIE MONSTER: Oh, well
me favorite movie was
"Manchester by the Letter C."
ELMO: That's a good one.
GROVER: Oh, that makes sense.

MICHAELA: Because C is for--
COOKIE MONSTER: Cookie.

MICHAELA: Right.
COOKIE MONSTER: Yes.
GROVER: Right, right.
MICHAELA: OK.

All right, so Grover, I imagine
that you had something you'd
lined up as your favorite.
GROVER: Oh, yeah, yeah.

My favorite is-- oh,
what is the name?

It's Knock--
Knock-something Animals.

COOKIE MONSTER:
"Nocturnal Animals?"

ELMO: "Nocturnal Animals?"
MICHAELA: "Nocturnal Animals."
GROVER: No, no, that's not it.
It was a funny movie.

Oh, Knock Knock Joke
Animals, that's it.
That's it.

COOKIE MONSTER: Yes.
GROVER: Hilarious.

MICHAELA: I feel
like you guys maybe

saw some different movies in
Hollywood than I saw this year.

ELMO: Oh, really?
COOKIE MONSTER: Really?
GROVER: Yeah?

MICHAELA: Yeah, I feel
like I saw very different

movies. "Nocturnal Animals,"
"Manchester by the Sea."
ELMO: Never heard of them.

MICHAELA: And "La La--"
never heard of any of them?

COOKIE MONSTER:
Me not know these.

MICHAELA: OK, well then
let me ask you this.

Who would you take
to the Oscars,

if you were getting all
dudded up in your tuxedo?

GROVER: Oh, well, that
is an easy question.
My mommy.
MICHAELA: Your mommy.
GROVER: Yeah.

MICHAELA: Oh, she'd love to
go with you, wouldn't she?
And how about you, Cookie?

Who would you take to
the Oscars as your date?

COOKIE MONSTER: Me
would take me grandmama.
MICHAELA: I love that.
Elmo?

ELMO: [inaudible] Elmo would
like to take uh, let's see.
Oh, Oscar the Grouch.

MICHAELA: Oscar the Grouch, he
would be a questionable date.
I think that he might--

GROVER: That is a
surprise answer.

MICHAELA: You'd have to--
it's a surprise answer.

ELMO: Lots of comments
on people's attire.
[laughter]
He's very interesting.

MICHAELA: I think they
are very interesting,

and they have a lot
of things to say.

Well, you guys have a
great take on Hollywood.

I think we need more of
your types in Hollywood
than, you know.
You know what I'm saying?

GROVER: I have no idea.
MICHAELA: Neither do I.
COOKIE MONSTER: Me not certain.

MICHAELA: You can catch
new episodes of "Sesame

Street's" 47th season--
congratulations--
every Saturday on HBO.

And of course, you can watch
"Sesame Street' every day
on HBO Family and PBS Kids.

Thanks for giving us a
little help in the bubble

today, fellas.
GROVER: Thank you, Michaela.

MICHAELA: Come back
and visit soon.

GROVER: Yes.
ELMO: Kiss, kiss.
COOKIE MONSTER: Yes.
MICHAELA: How about you, Cookie?
ELMO: Yay!
